flawed_nl_solution:
When she picks 1/4 of the number of tomatoes, she goes home with 1/4*100 = <<1/4*100=400/1>>400/1 tomatoes.
The total number of tomatoes remaining will be 100-400/1 = <<100-400/1=-300>>-300 tomatoes.
After picking 20 more tomatoes the following week, the number of tomatoes remaining is -300-20 = <<-300-20=-320>>-320 tomatoes.
The next week she picks twice the number she picked the previous week, that is 20*2 = <<20*2=40>>40 tomatoes.
The total number of tomatoes remaining after the final picking is -320-40 = <<-320-40=-360>>-360 tomatoes.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 25, not 400/1. It appears the value was multiplied by the reciprocal of the intended fraction.
